item.name: Authentication
item.description:
Authentication endpoints for user management

Required Headers:
- Content-Type: application/json

Environment Variables:
- {{token}}: JWT token received after login (automatically set)

Flow:
1. Register a new user
2. Login with credentials
3. Use the received token for authenticated requests

request.description:
Register a new user

Request Body:
- username: string (min 3 chars)
- email: valid email address
- password: string (min 6 chars)

Response:
- 201: User created successfully
- 400: Invalid input or user exists

Login with email and password

Request Body:
- email: registered email address
- password: user's password

Response:
- 200: Login successful (includes JWT token)
- 401: Invalid credentials

item.name: Monsters
item.description:
Monster management endpoints

Required Headers:
- Content-Type: application/json

Features:
- Create, read, update, and delete monsters
- Basic monster attributes management

request.description:
Get all monsters

Response:
- 200: List of monsters
- 500: Server error

Create a new monster

Request Body:
- name: Monster name (string)
- level: Monster level (number, min: 1)
- hp: Hit points (number, min: 1)
- attack: Attack power (number, min: 0)
- defense: Defense power (number, min: 0)
- description: Monster description (string)

Response:
- 201: Monster created
- 400: Invalid input

Get a specific monster by ID

URL Parameters:
- id: Monster ID

Response:
- 200: Monster details
- 404: Monster not found
- 500: Server error

Update a monster's attributes

URL Parameters:
- id: Monster ID

Request Body:
- name: Monster name (string, optional)
- level: Monster level (number, min: 1, optional)
- hp: Hit points (number, min: 1, optional)
- attack: Attack power (number, min: 0, optional)
- defense: Defense power (number, min: 0, optional)
- description: Monster description (string, optional)

Response:
- 200: Monster updated
- 404: Monster not found
- 400: Invalid input

Delete a monster

URL Parameters:
- id: Monster ID

Response:
- 200: Monster deleted successfully
- 404: Monster not found
- 500: Server error
